info.title: kronup api
info.description:
# API reference

The Kronup API follows [REST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) guidelines. All responses are [JSON-encoded](http://www.json.org/), with standard HTTP response codes and verbs.

# Frameworks

You can start building your Kronup application today with our [PHP SDK](https://kronup.github.io/kronup-php/).

# Authentication

Our API uses a [JSON Web Token](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON_Web_Token) for authentication. You can get your token form the settings page.

```
$ curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR.JWT.KEY"
```

# Errors

Conventional HTTP response codes are used to indicate the status of an API request.

| HTTP Status Codes |  |
|---|---|
| 400 - Bad Request | Invalid request, ususally due to a missing argument |
| 401 - Unauthorized | Authorization error due to invalid, expired or missing token |
| 402 - Request Failed | Request failed despite valid arguments |
| 403 - Forbidden | You are not allowed to perform that request |
| 404 - Not Found | Resource does not exist |
| 409 - Conflict | This request is in conflict with another |
| 429 - Too Many Requests | You are sending too many requests to our API servers |
| 5xx - Server Errors | Something went wrong with Kronup's servers |

## 401 Unauthorized

For status code `401 - Unauthorized` you can receive one of the following errors:

| Error ID | Error Message |
|---|---|
| jwt-missing | Authentication token missing |
| jwt-format | Invalid JWT token |
| jwt-format-header | Invalid JWT header |
| jwt-format-body | Invalid JWT body |
| jwt-payload | Invalid JWT payload |
| jwt-issuer | Invalid JWT issuer |
| jwt-public-key | Could not fetch JWT public key |
| auth-missing | Authorization header missing |
| auth-invalid | Wrong authorization strategy |
| auth-api-invalid | API user does not exist |
| auth-api-expired | API token is no longer valid |
| auth-api-limited | API daily usage limit reached |

tags.name: Account
tags.description:
Manage the current account. 
These methods apply to the identity declared in the authorization bearer token.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
Manage users within the scope of an organization.

There are 3 site-level roles: **admin**, **moderator** and **user**.

Admins and moderators have access to account data outside of their organization (read as **A can B**):


|  | B: admin | B: moderator | B: user |
|---|---|---|---|
| A: admin | read/write | read/write | read/write |
| A: moderator | read | read/write | read/write |
| A: user | - | - | - |


There are 3 organization-level roles: **owner**, **manager** and **member**.

Within the same organization, account actions are limited (read as **A can B**):


|  | B: owner | B: manager | B: member |
|---|---|---|---|
| A: owner | read/write | read/write | read/write |
| A: manager | read | read/write | read/write |
| A: member | read | read | read |



* Any account has **read/write** permissions over **itself**
* Site-level roles have priority over organization-level roles for **write** rules
* Organization-level roles have priority over site-level roles for **read** rules

tags.name: Organizations
tags.description:
Each account owns at most **500** Organizations.

These are the role-based access control rules for organizations:

| Organization Role \ Action | Read * | Write * | Delete ** |
|---|---|---|---|
| Owner | yes | yes | yes |
| Manager | yes | yes | no |
| Member | yes | no | no |


(*) The **read** and **write** actions refer to all endpoints that require the **x-org-id** header.

(**) The **delete** action refers to removing the Organization model.

tags.name: Invitations
tags.description:
Invitations follow the [Organization](#tag/Organizations) role-based access control rules.

Each organization can have a maximum of **1000** invitations.

tags.name: Teams
tags.description: Each Organization has at least **1** and at most **500** Teams.

tags.name: Team channels
tags.description: Each Team has at least **1** and at most **250** Channels.

tags.name: Value items
tags.description: Value items are commonly referred to as `issues` in project management.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.kronup.com/v1/account \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://api.kronup.com/v1/account")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.kronup.com/v1/account",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.kronup.com/v1/account \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"userName":"John Doe"}'

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://api.kronup.com/v1/account")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
request["content-type"] = 'application/json'
request.body = "{\"userName\":\"John Doe\"}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.kronup.com/v1/account",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "{\"userName\":\"John Doe\"}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN",
    "content-type: application/json"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

delete.description: Delete the current account. This action is reversible only if you sign back in within 14 days. API calls and service accounts cannot restore deleted accounts.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request DELETE \
  --url https://api.kronup.com/v1/account \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://api.kronup.com/v1/account")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Delete.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.kronup.com/v1/account",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "DELETE",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

inviteDomain.description: User email domain name. If specified, restrict access to e-mail addresses belonging to this domain.

inviteExpireDays.description: The invitation expires after this many days. 0 = no expiration

inviteUsesMax.description: The invitation expires after being used this many times. 0 = no expiration

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://api.kronup.com/v1/invitations/invitation-id-***' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-org-id: org-id-***' \
  --data '{"inviteName":"string","inviteDomain":"","inviteOrgRole":"member","inviteExpireDays":5,"inviteUsesMax":10}'

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://api.kronup.com/v1/invitations/invitation-id-***")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)
request["x-org-id"] = 'org-id-***'
request["Authorization"] = 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
request["content-type"] = 'application/json'
request.body = "{\"inviteName\":\"string\",\"inviteDomain\":\"\",\"inviteOrgRole\":\"member\",\"inviteExpireDays\":5,\"inviteUsesMax\":10}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.kronup.com/v1/invitations/invitation-id-***",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "{\"inviteName\":\"string\",\"inviteDomain\":\"\",\"inviteOrgRole\":\"member\",\"inviteExpireDays\":5,\"inviteUsesMax\":10}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN",
    "content-type: application/json",
    "x-org-id: org-id-***"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

inviteExpireDays.description: The invitation expires after this many days. 0 = no expiration

inviteUsesMax.description: The invitation expires after being used this many times. 0 = no expiration

post.description: Add a value item to planning

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.kronup.com/v1/users/user-id-***",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

200.description: User updated. Returns updated fields and their new values

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://api.kronup.com/v1/users/user-id-***' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-org-id: org-id-***' \
  --data '{"roleSite":"user","roleOrg":"member"}'

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://api.kronup.com/v1/users/user-id-***")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)
request["x-org-id"] = 'org-id-***'
request["Authorization"] = 'Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN'
request["content-type"] = 'application/json'
request.body = "{\"roleSite\":\"user\",\"roleOrg\":\"member\"}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.kronup.com/v1/users/user-id-***",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "{\"roleSite\":\"user\",\"roleOrg\":\"member\"}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN",
    "content-type: application/json",
    "x-org-id: org-id-***"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

request["x-org-id"] = 'org-id-***'

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.kronup.com/v1/users/user-id-***",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",

type.description:
Value Item Type
  * `f` - Feature
  * `b` - Bug fix
  * `c` - Chore

priority.description:
Value Item Priority using MoSCoW
  * `m` - Must-have
  * `s` - Should-have
  * `c` - Could-have
  * `w` - Will NOT have

ItemStage.description:
Value Item Stage
  * `p` - Planning
  * `v` - Validation
  * `x` - Execution
  * `c` - Deep Context

digest.description:
Assumptions are formulated as simple statements that can be proven true or false; avoid questions and opinions.

> ❌ What are the features?
> 
> ❌ Does this feature exist?
> 
> ❌ I don't like this feature.
> 
> ✅ This feature exists.
Experiment findings formulated in one sentence

state.description:
Task state
  * `i` - Idle
  * `p` - In progress
  * `r` - In review
  * `d` - Done
